text.p: Finnish engineering group Tampella Oy rose on Tuesday in active trade sparked by technical factors after the share passed its earlier calendar year-high last week, brokers said.

At 1500/1300 GMT, Tampella traded at 11.60 markka, up 0.70 markka or more than six percent, after hitting a new 13-month high 11.70 markka . Trade was a fair 4.5 million markka, which is lively for Tampella.
Tampella last week broke its earlier calendar year-high 10.90 markka, set on May 24.
Some brokers said Tampella was also helped by improved earnings prospects after the group in October released its January-August report.
That report showed a 109 million markka profit before extraordinary items and tax, reversing a loss of 127 million markka in the first eight months of 1995.
